# measurementUnits | Apple Developer Documentation

- [ AppKit ](/documentation/appkit)

- [ NSRulerView ](/documentation/appkit/nsrulerview)

- [ measurementUnits ](/documentation/appkit/nsrulerview/measurementunits)

- [ NSRulerView ](/documentation/appkit/nsrulerview)

-  measurementUnits 

Instance Property# measurementUnits

The measurement units used by the ruler to `unitName`.macOS

```
@MainActor
var measurementUnits: NSRulerView.UnitName { get set }
```

## [Discussion](/documentation/appkit/nsrulerview/measurementunits#Discussion)

`unitName` must have been registered with the NSRulerView class object prior to invoking this method. See the description of the class method [`registerUnit(withName:abbreviation:unitToPointsConversionFactor:stepUpCycle:stepDownCycle:)`](/documentation/appkit/nsrulerview/registerunit(withname:abbreviation:unittopointsconversionfactor:stepupcycle:stepdowncycle:)) for a list of predefined units.

## [See Also](/documentation/appkit/nsrulerview/measurementunits#see-also)

### [Altering measurement units](/documentation/appkit/nsrulerview/measurementunits#Altering-measurement-units)

[`class func registerUnit(withName: NSRulerView.UnitName, abbreviation: String, unitToPointsConversionFactor: CGFloat, stepUpCycle: [NSNumber], stepDownCycle: [NSNumber])`](/documentation/appkit/nsrulerview/registerunit(withname:abbreviation:unittopointsconversionfactor:stepupcycle:stepdowncycle:))Registers a new unit of measurement with the NSRulerView class, making it available to all instances of NSRulerView.[`struct UnitName`](/documentation/appkit/nsrulerview/unitname)
